results.title: Winners: The Other Facts of Life
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Julia Overton, Sandra Levy, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, ITC Entertainment, New South Wales Film Corporation and Morris Gleitzman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Ben can’t understand how people can live so happily with the injustice and disaster going on in the world. His family’s lack of response leads Ben to mount a one person awareness crusade. Nothing seems to distract Ben from the larger troubles of the world until a crisis causes him to focus his energies on loving and helping his family.

Cast includes Dennis Miller, Anne Grigg, and Ken Talbot.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Esben Storm, Julia Overton, Sandra Levy, Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, ITC Entertainment, New South Wales Film Corporation and Morris Gleitzman

results.title: MIMA Yearbook. Vol. 2
results.brief_description: Volume two of a three volume set, this video compilation of excerpts of Australian film and video art covers the period from 1980-1983, and is a unique and tantalising entry into non-mainstream history of Australian film and video.
results.description: Volume two of a three volume set, this video compilation of excerpts of Australian film and video art covers the period from 1980-1983, and is a unique and tantalising entry into non-mainstream history of Australian film and video.

results.title: Victoria : The First 150 Years
results.creator_credit: Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria
results.brief_description: An overview of Victoria covering its history, culture and landscape. Gold, sport, bushfires and rural Victoria are amongst the subjects covered and there is also a significant use of historical film footage in this description of Victoria.
results.description: An overview of Victoria covering its history, culture and landscape. Gold, sport, bushfires and rural Victoria are amongst the subjects covered and there is also a significant use of historical film footage in this description of Victoria.

results.title: Golden summers: the Heidelberg school
results.creator_credit: Peter Purvis, Peter Bramley and National Gallery of Victoria
results.brief_description: Golden Summers covers the most celebrated period in the history of Australian art, the years from 1885 until shortly after the turn of the century. The artists at the time were Tom Roberts, Arthur Streeton, Charles Conder and Fred McCubbin, popularly known as the Heidelberg School, and they believed that it was their task to paint Australian realities. Narrated by Patrick McCaughey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Purvis, Peter Bramley and National Gallery of Victoria

results.title: On guard
results.creator_credit: Susan Lambert, Digby Duncan and Red Heart Pictures
results.brief_description: A fast moving adventure about four women who conspire to sabotage the research program of Utero, a multinational firm engaged in reproductive engineering. They plan a midnight raid on Utero’s heavily guarded plant and as the time for the raid approaches, tensions between the four saboteurs increase.

results.title: Image makers (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ursula Kolbe and Institute of Early Childhood Studies (Waverley, N.S.W.)
results.brief_description:
Looks at the way children make images and how this helps them explore and cope with the world at large, giving it order and meaning.

Includes footage from the Murawina Aboriginal Education Centre in Redfern, Sydney.

results.title: Greek tragic theatre (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Brenton Holmes and Department of Further Education, South Australia
results.brief_description: Examines the elements of Greek Tragedy - looking in particular at Euripides and Sophocles, their themes, theatrical styles and cultural significance.
